alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Pointe Coupee; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 9:23PM CDT until May 27 at 3:24PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Mississippi River At Red River Landing affecting West Feliciana, East Baton Rouge and Pointe Coupee Parishes. For the Lower Mississippi River...including Red River Landing, Baton Rouge, Donaldsonville, Reserve, New Orleans...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY, MAY 27... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Red River Landing. * WHEN...Until Friday, May 27. * IMPACTS...At 51.0 feet, All river islands along the reach from Red River Landing to Baton Rouge will be inundated. Recreational camps and river bottom farm land will be under water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 47.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 50.5 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 48.8 feet on 04/22/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Pointe Coupee; West Feliciana
